result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Alan Farvour

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Plea & Sentencing Hearing - January 26, 2016

1:37 pm cases called- 15CF78, 15CF148 & 15CM143. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and read into record by DA Blader. Preliminary hearing on 15CF148-Court addresses preliminary hearing-defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  15CF148-No Contest to Count 1. No Contest to Count 2. No Contest to Count 7. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 3, 4, 5, 6, & 8 of 15CF148, 15CF78 & 15CM143. Statement by victim in 15CM143. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Selsing. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1-5 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 2 years Initial Confinement & 3 Years Extended Supervision. Credit for 98 days served. COUNT 2- 3 1/2 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 18 month Intial Confinement and 24 months Extended Supervision. Concurrent to Count 1. COUNT 7- SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year, Consecutive to Count 1 & Count 2. CONDITIONS OF ES & Probation: AODA and follow through,   Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with any females under the age of 18 years of age unless in the immediate company of a parent. No Contact with C. or R. Hohenstein. Defendant not to possess any pseudoephederine and/or ephederine. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court directs costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings. Restitution in the amount of $50.00 to be paid. Bond to be applied.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court finds defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Appeal Rights Given.

11:54 am case called. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader. Attorney Selsing makes a statement to court regarding adjournment. Court makes statement regarding request of Attorney Selsing and respectfully declines to modify bond. Statement by DA regarding offer if defendant were to post bond. Court admonishes defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

15CF-78 and 15CM-143 - Both Cases Called @ Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Attorney John Selsing in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Selsing:  Counsel have agreed that Atty Selsing will take over as lead counsel on all matters.  Atty Zilles concurs with Atty Selsing.  Both counsel have rec'd State's global resolution from the State, agrees with continued representation by Atty Selsing.  Per DA:  State will not object for the sake of efficiency to resolve all matters.  Atty Zilles confirms he intends to withdraw and turn cases over to Atty Selsing.  Def agrees with the withdrawal of Atty Zilles.  Def advised that he must contact SPD for appointment of Atty Selsing.  Per Atty Selsing:  For less paperwork, suggests that Atty Zilles appear by telephone for sentencing hearing.  DA:  Would suggest a cleaner transition in light of recommendation being made on resolution.  The Court:  Will accept Motion to Withdrawn of Atty Zilles.  Atty Zilles will contact SPD as should Def for subsequent counsel to be appointed.  Atty Selsing should not have to prepare any additional paperwork.  Atty Zilles will make arrangements to turn discovery over to Atty Selsing.  STC scheduled for 12/11/2015 as per 15CF-148.  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Final pre-trial at 11-13-2015 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 12-03-2015 08:00 am.

15CF78 & 15CM143 Cases called @ 2:08 p.m. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zilles requesting a jury trial on both cases. The court will schedule a jury trial on 15CF78 and will schedule a STC at the same time on 15CM143. Jury trial scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

10:32 am cases called. 15CF78 & 15CM143. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Zilles, states defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint and finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Zilles confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters a plea of Not Guilty.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
The defendant is to comply with requirements with Sex Offender Registry.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

1:52 pm cases called-15CF78 & 15CM143. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive the time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 10:15 am.
